intro: Vandellia alba, commonly known as the white vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its pale green to white leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and marshy areas. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Vandellia alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
